ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Understood more about the history and the practice of Baroque Opera (performance and compositional techniques). Put this into practice by performing in the baroque opera production.
This class was my first foray into baroque music and it was absolutely amazing. Never have I participated in a production of such high caliber.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Overall a fantastic course. I thought the lectures were, on the whole, more varied and interesting than last year's. I did find it hard to write the first essay because I had almost no source material to refer to. Perhaps a prompt that works for all characters equally would have worked better.

The course provides students with a great opportunity to practice their skills but fails to provide students with the fundamentals that would allow them to do this in the best way possible. Thus, it requires that students come in with a certain level of knowledge... this seemed particularly evident with Italian diction.
This show is both theatrically and musically challenging and was so much fun.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This class is one of the things at Yale that allows undergrads to bridge the gap between college and conservatory. It makes Yale special for serious singers. If you're interested in intensive performance and amazing productions, take this course.

YBOP is such a great experience and can be very different based on the background that you come from and also the part that you are given. Either way, you will probably spend a lot of time practicing your music and in rehearsals, but in the end it is worth it for the high quality of the production and the amazing experience of working with high quality professors and performing on the University Theater.
